item.title: 法国和西班牙 8 月通胀率低于预期
item.description: 法国和西班牙本月的通胀率略低于预期，但表明整个欧元区的通胀率没有出现大的偏差，欧元区的物价增长最近达到了欧洲中央银行 2% 的目标。【原文：Inflation in France and Spain was a touch less than expected this month but suggested no major deviation for the euro zone as a whole, where price growth recently hit the European Central Bank’s 2% target.】

item.title: 纳米比亚石油热点聚焦非洲野生动物公司的新油井
item.description: 为了在一个比罗德岛还大的区块寻找石油前景，Travis Smithard 在最后一刻决定将 Noble Venturer 号钻井船派到比原计划远一倍的地方，在纳米比亚海岸附近打井。【原文：Searching for oil prospects in a block bigger than Rhode Island, Travis Smithard made a last-minute decision to send the Noble Venturer drillship twice as far as originally planned to spud a well off Namibia’s coast.】

item.title: 俄罗斯原油流入受到审查，印度加紧购买美国原油
item.description: 在价格下跌之后，印度炼油厂加大了对美国原油的购买力度，因为华盛顿打击了这个亚洲国家购买俄罗斯原油的行为。【原文：Indian refiners have stepped up their purchases of US crude after price drops, as Washington cracks down on the Asian nation for buying Russian barrels.】

item.title: 日本在创纪录的 600 亿美元国防预算提案中考虑部署无人机舰队
item.description: 日本防卫省正在为 4 月开始的财政年度申请创纪录的 8.8 万亿日元（598 亿美元）国家预算份额，其中包括用于无人机和远程导弹舰队的资金，以应对来自中国和朝鲜日益严峻的挑战。【原文：Japan’s Defense Ministry is requesting a record ¥8.8 trillion ($59.8 billion) for its share of the national budget for the fiscal year starting in April, including money for fleets of drones and long-range missiles to counter growing challenges from China and North Korea.】

item.title: 新西兰央行行长尼尔-奎格利（Neil Quigley）在奥尔辞职仅六个月后辞职
item.description: 新西兰储备银行行长尼尔-奎格利（Neil Quigley）辞去了他的职务，这距离前行长阿德里安-奥尔（Adrian Orr）辞去央行职务仅过去了六个月。【原文：Reserve Bank of New Zealand Chair Neil Quigley has resigned from his post, just six months after former governor Adrian Orr quit the central bank.】

item.title: 中国警告不要在蓬勃发展的人工智能竞赛中进行 "无序竞争
item.description: 中国表示，它将防止红火的人工智能领域出现过度竞争，这是一个信号，表明中国政府希望避免浪费投资，即使它正努力将人工智能技术转变为经济的重要支柱。【原文：China said it will prevent excess competition in the red-hot artificial intelligence sector, a signal that Beijing wants to avoid wasteful investment even as it seeks to turn the technology into a key pillar of the economy.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国股市连跌三日后将上涨
波兰储蓄者被股票波动所伤，错过历史性反弹
item.description: 数年来最大规模的股市上涨正在将波兰的普通投资者排除在外。【原文：The biggest stock market rally in years is leaving out Poland’s ordinary investors.】

item.title: 南非兰特和股票在八月创下历史最高涨幅
item.description: 由于美元走软刺激了对美国以外高收益资产的需求，南非货币有望在八月份创下二十年来的最大涨幅，股票也不甘落后。【原文：South Africa’s currency is on track for its biggest August gain in two decades, with stocks not far behind, as a weakening dollar spurs demand for high-yielding assets outside the US.】

item.title: 习莫会聚焦中国向印度出口稀土旱情
item.description: 尽管中印关系有所升温，但这个南亚国家的汽车制造商仍然缺乏重稀土磁铁的供应；他们希望这个问题能在纳伦德拉-莫迪总理本周末会见习近平主席时得到解决。【原文：Despite a warming of the China-India relationship, automakers in the South Asian country still a lack supply of heavy rare earth magnets — an issue they hope can be resolved when Prime Minister Narendra Modi meets President Xi Jinping this weekend.】

item.title: 新西兰考虑放宽外国富人购房禁令
item.description: 新西兰正在考虑允许一些富有的外国人购买豪宅，对目前禁止海外买家购买豪宅的规定进行豁免，以吸引更多的高净值投资者。【原文：New Zealand is considering letting some wealthy foreigners buy luxury homes, creating an exemption to the current ban on overseas buyers as it seeks to attract more high-net-worth investors.】

item.title: 日本赤泽将在行政命令颁布前再次访美
item.description: 日本最高贸易谈判代表表示，他预计在特朗普政府发布正式降低从日本进口商品关税的行政命令之前至少再访问美国一次。【原文：Japan’s top trade negotiator said he expects to visit the US at least once more before the Trump administration issues an executive order that would formally lower tariffs on goods imported from Japan.】

item.title: 在美国关税影响前景之前，印度经济可能稳健增长
item.description: 由于对与华盛顿达成贸易协议持乐观态度，印度经济在 6 月季度可能实现了健康增长，不过，由于印度受到美国在亚洲征收的最高关税的影响，印度经济前景有所暗淡。【原文：India’s economy likely grew at a healthy clip in the June quarter amid optimism over a trade deal with Washington, although the outlook has since darkened as the country comes under the highest US tariffs in Asia.】

item.title: 为何 "最低关税豁免 "的终止会带来价格上涨和运输延误的风险？
item.description: 今年，一个在报关行之外鲜为人知的拉丁语词汇成为了头条新闻。这要归功于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）决定终止对 "微量 "商品实行了近 90 年的免关税待遇。【原文：A Latin term that used to be little-known outside the world of customs brokers has become the stuff of headlines this year. That’s thanks to a decision by US President Donald Trump to end the tariff-free treatment of “de minimis” merchandise that had been in place for almost 90 years.】

item.title: 铁矿石今年首次连续月度上涨
item.description: 由于北京附近的一个钢铁枢纽减产，加上有报道称政府将在明年采取限产措施，铁矿石价格受到提振，连续第二个月上涨。【原文：Iron ore headed for a second monthly gain as output cuts at a steel hub near Beijing and a report that authorities will move to limit production next year buoyed prices.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行警告私人市场繁荣带来金融稳定风险
item.description: 澳大利亚央行警告说，全球融资从受监管银行向私人市场的转移正在加大政府控制金融体系风险的难度，几天前澳大利亚的企业监管机构还誓言要加强对该行业的审查。【原文：Australia’s central bank warned that a global shift of financing away from regulated banks and into private markets is making it harder for authorities to contain risks to the financial system, days after the nation’s corporate watchdog vowed to step up scrutiny of the sector.】

item.title: 金正恩加深与普京和习近平的关系，朝鲜经济不断发展
item.description: 据韩国央行称，随着金正恩收紧与莫斯科的关系以及与中国的贸易持续增长，朝鲜去年的经济增长速度达到了自2016年以来的最快水平。【原文：North Korea’s economy grew last year at its fastest pace since 2016, according to South Korea’s central bank, as Kim Jong Un tightens ties with Moscow and trade with China continues to increase.】

item.title: 马斯克寻求撤销美国证券交易委员会对 Twitter 股权披露的起诉
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）要求联邦法官驳回美国证券交易委员会（US Securities and Exchange Commission）对他在2022年增持推特公司（Twitter Inc.【原文：Elon Musk asked a federal judge to dismiss a US Securities and Exchange Commission lawsuit over his growing stake in Twitter Inc. in 2022, calling allegations that he cheated investors government overreach.】

item.title: 表现最佳的日本银行利用短期债券应对日本央行前景
item.description: Hokuhoku Financial Group Inc. 的股票是今年日本银行中表现最好的，该公司正在寻求短期政府债券的收益，为国内利率上升做准备。【原文：Hokuhoku Financial Group Inc., whose shares are the best performers among Japanese banks this year, is hunting for yields from short-dated government bonds as it prepares for rising interest rates at home.】

item.title: 金正恩的中国之行显示核外交的动态变化
item.description: 就在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示愿意会见朝鲜领导人金正恩的几天后，平壤以自己的方式做出了回应，宣布金正恩将前往中国参加阅兵式，与俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔-普京会合。【原文：Just days after US President Donald Trump said he’d like to meet North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, Pyongyang responded in its own way, by announcing Kim’s trip to join Russian President Vladimir Putin at China’s military parade.】

item.title: 美国和中国释放积极信号，铜价有望实现四周连涨
item.description: 由于世界两大经济体的积极经济数据提振了铜的需求前景，铜有望实现连续第四周上涨。【原文：Copper was on track for a fourth weekly advance, with positive economic data from the world’s two biggest economies buoying its demand outlook.】

item.title: Nvidia 因工程师 "偷窃 "代码而面临审判
item.description: 英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp. ）的一名工程师无意中泄露了自动驾驶技术的商业机密，据称他是从前雇主那里窃取的。【原文：Nvidia Corp. must face trial in the case of an engineer who inadvertently revealed autonomous driving trade secrets that he allegedly stole from a former employer.】

item.title: 印尼镍产量飙升，中国创业板公司利润创历史新高
item.description: 中国电池材料生产商创业板股份有限公司（GEM Co. Ltd. ）公布了创纪录的上半年利润，印尼工厂的镍产量激增为其带来了助益。【原文：Chinese battery-materials producer GEM Co. Ltd. posted record first-half profit, aided by surging nickel output from plants in Indonesia.】

item.title: 据说贝恩将吸引中国竞标者竞购价值 40 亿美元的数据中心
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，贝恩资本旗下 Chindata Group Holdings Ltd.拥有的中国数据中心业务引起了当地竞标者的兴趣，他们希望通过拓展该行业来利用人工智能的蓬勃发展。【原文：The China data center business owned by Bain Capital’s Chindata Group Holdings Ltd. has drawn interest from local bidders seeking to expand in the sector to tap a boom in artificial intelligence, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 电池销售有望带动 CATL 股价创 2024 年 10 月以来最大涨幅
item.description: 中国电池制造商当代安培科技股份有限公司（Contemporary Amperex Technology Co.【原文：Chinese battery maker Contemporary Amperex Technology Co.’s shares soared, with investors pinning the rally to a stronger outlook for sales following an earnings report from a supplier.】

item.title: 印度市场受关税困扰，Reliance 年度投资者会议成为焦点
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 日本赤泽称有望在行政命令颁布前访问美国
item.description: 日本最高贸易谈判代表赤泽亮世说，在特朗普政府发布降低对日关税的行政命令之前，他预计将至少再访问美国一次。【原文：Japan’s top trade negotiator Ryosei Akazawa says he expects to visit the US at least once more before the Trump administration issues an executive order to lower tariffs on Japan.】

item.title: 阿里巴巴和 JD.com 的交易为亚洲贷款市场注入强心针
item.description: 科技巨头阿里巴巴集团控股有限公司（Alibaba Group Holding Ltd.）和京东商城（JD.com）计划筹集数十亿美元的外汇资金，为亚太地区银团贷款市场注入了一股活力。【原文：Technology giants Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. and JD.com are adding a jolt of energy to the Asian-Pacific syndicated loan market with plans to raise billions of dollars in foreign currency.】

item.title: 卢拉授权针对特朗普关税的报复程序
item.description: 巴西副总统杰拉尔多-阿尔克明（Geraldo Alckmin）表示，巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）授权启动一项程序，对唐纳德-特朗普征收的 50%关税进行报复。【原文：Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva authorized the start of a process to retaliate against the 50% tariffs imposed by Donald Trump, Vice President Geraldo Alckmin said.】

item.title: 韩国预算增长 8.1%，在关税影响下促进经济增长
item.description: 韩国新一届自由派政府计划大幅增加年度预算，以重振受到美国关税、福利成本上升和人口老龄化（韩国是世界上出生率最低的国家之一）压力的经济。【原文：South Korea’s new liberal government plans a hefty expansion of its annual budget to revive an economy under pressure from US tariffs, rising welfare costs and an aging population with one of the world’s lowest birth rates.】
